title: must_use lint: add with overflow

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Found with a [modified fuzz-rustc](https://github.com/jruderman/fuzz-rustc)

### Code

```Rust
fn main() {
    [0; usize::MAX];
}
```

### Error output

When trying to build using a compiler that has overflow checks enabled:

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'attempt to add with overflow', [compiler/rustc_lint/src/unused.rs:284](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/aa05f99001924004757ebd44b54bb6a4dd30c8bd/compiler/rustc_lint/src/unused.rs#L284)

### Version

Built stage1 from aa05f99001924004757ebd44b54bb6a4dd30c8bd with overflow checks enabled

<details><summary>config.toml</summary>

```
# Includes one of the default files in src/bootstrap/defaults
profile = "compiler"
changelog-seen = 2

[llvm]
download-ci-llvm = true     # Download a pre-built LLVM?
assertions = true           # LLVM assertions on?

[rust]

debug-assertions = true
overflow-checks = true
```

</details>
